Kuiper Belt.CatText: The Kuiper Belt is a region of the Solar System beyond Neptune, populated with small icy bodies.

Arrokoth.Text: Arrokoth is a contact binary Kuiper belt object that was visited by the New Horizons spacecraft in 2019. It is composed of two lobes that are thought to have gently collided and stuck together in the early Solar System. Its surface is covered in a mixture of ices and organic compounds, giving it a reddish color.
Factoids: Arrokoth has a bilobed shape resembling a snowman.
It was discovered in 2014 using the Hubble Space Telescope.
Named 'Arrokoth', meaning 'sky' in the Powhatan/Algonquian language, in 2020.
Has a very low density, suggesting it is composed mostly of ice with some rock.
Provides insights into the conditions of the early Solar System and the formation of planetesimals.

Varuna.Text: Varuna is a large Kuiper belt object that is considered a possible dwarf planet. It has a rapid rotation period and an elongated shape, suggesting it may be a contact binary or have a significant elongation due to its spin. Varuna's surface is thought to be composed of water ice and other ices, giving it a relatively bright appearance compared to other Kuiper belt objects.
Factoids: Varuna has a rotation period of approximately 6.34 hours.
Named after the Hindu god of water and the celestial ocean.

Uni.Text: Unis is a mid-sized Kuiper belt object that orbits the Sun beyond Neptune. It has a relatively circular orbit and is thought to be composed of a mixture of rock and ice. Unis's surface is believed to be covered in a layer of complex organic compounds, giving it a reddish color.
Factoids: Unis has an estimated diameter of around 300 kilometers.
Named after the ancient Egyptian goddess of the sky.

2003_VS_2.Text: 2003 VS2 is Kuiper belt object, which like Pluto, orbits the sun in a 3:2 resonance with Neptune. It has a relatively bright surface, suggesting it may be covered in a layer of ices. 2003 VS2's orbit is less eccentric and inclined than Pluto however.

2003_UZ_413.Text: 2003 UZ413 is a Kuiper belt object that orbits the Sun beyond Neptune. It has a relatively circular orbit and is thought to be composed of a mixture of rock and ice. 2003 UZ413's surface is believed to be covered in a layer of complex organic compounds, giving it a reddish color.  It's very likely a dwarf planet but isn't currently classified as such pending confirmation.
Factoids: Has a very high density compared with other Kuiper belt objects.
Has a rapid rotation period of approximately 4.13 hours.
